intro: Anthogyas, commonly known as the "butterfly flower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their intricate, often colorful blooms that resemble butterflies, hence their common name. Anthogyas species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid environments. They possess specialized orchid-like structures, including showy petals and modified leaves that aid in pollination. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral patterns and growth habits.
